top_categories.workout_context: 69ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Greek Gravel's Greek mountains, Mountainous gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 65 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Greek Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
When someone attacks on greek mountainous gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
At Greek Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Greek Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
65 miles on greek mountainous gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Varied gradients on greek mountainous gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Greek Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Base fitness for Greek Gravel. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on greek mountainous gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Greek Gravel’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Greek Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Greek Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on greek mountainous gravel to build confidence. Expect: greek mountains, mountainous gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 65 miles of greek mountainous gravel in Peloponnese, Greece.
